ygData.subject: Re: Petition
ygData.msgSnippet: I can solo up to yellows outdoors most of the time.  With some exceptions. Gorge and Chasm minos whoop my skinny elf butt if they are white or better. I have
ygData.messageBody:
I can solo up to yellows outdoors most of the time. With some exceptions.
Gorge and Chasm minos whoop my skinny elf butt if they are white or better.
I have even found some rough blue ones.

Overall though I can solo regularly and effectively with my ranger. I think
I tank better in a group as well because I reserve all my mana for heals and
in between fights I don't require the help of a cleric.



-----Original Message-----
From: Mifsud, Michael <Michael.Mifsud@...>
To: 'warriors_eq@onelist.com' <warriors_eq@onelist.com>
Date: Tuesday, June 15, 1999 11:25 PM
Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Petition


>From: "Mifsud, Michael" <Michael.Mifsud@...>
>
>Well would you believe I have done the same thing - I started a Ranger. I
>find them in melee much weaker then warriors and it took me longer to get
to
>15 then it did with my warrior (using /played time). Not much longer but
>longer.
>
>The ability to track down foes, root them, arrow and burn them is a great
>ability. My warrior heart is satisfied with the fact that they get all,
bar
>one, warrior skill. I believe I will stick with this ranger.
>
>Tom did you solo any orcs? Just curious since I find soloing outdoor stuff
>with the ranger quite easy. Normally can reduce a yellow to 50% hp before
>engaging with them hand-to-hand (or hand-to-talon or paw or well you get
the
>drift).
>
>Mahlyn
>Ranger of the 15th Season.
>
>> ----------
>> From: Tom Swift[SMTP:tswift@...]
>> Reply To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
>> Sent: Tuesday, June 15, 1999 12:34 AM
>> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
>> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Petition
>>
>> From: "Tom Swift" <tswift@...>
>>
>> Careful...rangers are equivalent combatants to warriors, even though some
>> skills lag a few levels behind. The magic you get more than makes up for
>> any deficiency.
>>
>> I did the same as you and now find myself playing the ranger more and
>> more,
>> it is easier to level because I only have to stop and rest after 3 or 4
>> fights with blues. I fight, expend mana on heals, and fight over and
over
>> till mana is gone, then I cast invisble on myself and rest till mana is
>> restored and repeat. I made level 16 in about 2/3rds the playing time it
>> took to do the same with my warrior. and I am comparing in game time
>> (/played) not real life time.
>>
>> Now I have hit the wall I did with my warrior, except this time it is
>> level
>> 16 and not 14. Oasis isn't the hunting ground it used to be on Bertox,
>> and
>> I never cared for boring croc hunting anyway. I am right now touring
>> Antonica looking for a new temporary home. Looks like Highpass will be
it
>> for awhile. Excellent loot and experience.
>>
>> Problem is the orc end is so camped with people looking for halberds it
is
>> hard to get any of the orcs. Wizard item farmers tend to steal kills from
>> all but large groups. Gnolls are good fun though...love smacking those
>> doggies around with my shiny brass halberd
>>
>>
>>
>>
>> -----Original Message-----

kicking

>> skill
>> >cap from Warriors. No reason a Warrior shouldn't be better at melee
than
>> >anyone else.
